questions.question: What is the difference between a compiler and an interpreter?

answers.text: A compiler translates the entire source code into machine code before execution.
An interpreter translates the entire source code into machine code before execution.
An interpreter translates and executes code line by line.

questions.question: Explain the concept of Object-Oriented Programming (OOP).

answers.text: OOP is a programming paradigm based on procedural programming.
OOP is a programming paradigm based on the concept of objects.
OOP is a programming paradigm based on functional programming.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a constructor in object-oriented programming?

answers.text: To destroy objects.
To create objects.
To update objects.

questions.question: What is the difference between TCP and UDP?

answers.text: TCP provides unreliable, connectionless communication.
TCP provides reliable, connection-oriented communication.
UDP provides reliable, connection-oriented communication.

questions.question: Explain the concept of recursion in programming.

answers.text: Recursion is a programming technique that uses loops.
Recursion is a programming technique that calls a function within itself.
Recursion is a programming technique that uses arrays.

questions.question: What are the advantages of using version control systems?

answers.text: Version control systems allow only one developer to work on a project.
Version control systems track changes and facilitate collaboration among developers.
Version control systems slow down the development process.

questions.question: What is a database index and why is it important?

answers.text: A database index is used to encrypt sensitive data.
A database index is used to improve the speed of data retrieval operations.
A database index is used to delete data from a database.

questions.question: Explain the concept of Big O notation.

answers.text: Big O notation is used to describe the size of a computer's hard disk.
Big O notation is used to describe the efficiency of algorithms.
Big O notation is used to describe the number of pixels on a computer screen.

questions.question: What is the difference between a stack and a queue?

answers.text: A stack follows the First In, First Out (FIFO) principle.
A stack follows the Last In, First Out (LIFO) principle.
A stack follows the Last In, Last Out (LILO) principle.

questions.question: What is a binary tree?

answers.text: A binary tree is a data structure where each node has only one child.
A binary tree is a data structure where each node has at most two children.
A binary tree is a data structure where each node has exactly two children.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'finally' block in exception handling?

answers.text: To handle exceptions.
To define code that will be executed whether an exception is raised or not.
To catch exceptions.

questions.question: Explain the concept of polymorphism.

answers.text: Polymorphism is the ability of a single interface to be used for a single type or implementation.
Polymorphism is the ability of multiple interfaces to be used for different types or implementations.
Polymorphism is the ability of a single interface to be used to denote different types or implementations.

questions.question: What is SQL injection and how can it be prevented?

answers.text: SQL injection is a method for improving database performance.
SQL injection is a type of security vulnerability.
SQL injection is a type of encryption technique.

questions.question: What are the differences between HTML and CSS?

answers.text: HTML is used to style the appearance of web pages.
CSS is used to structure the content of web pages.
HTML is used to structure the content of web pages, while CSS is used to style the appearance of HTML elements.

questions.question: What is the role of a DNS server?

answers.text: A DNS server translates IP addresses into domain names.
A DNS server translates domain names into IP addresses.
A DNS server stores files and data for websites.

questions.question: Explain the concept of MVC architecture in web development.

answers.text: MVC architecture is used to define the layout of web pages.
MVC architecture is used to manage databases in web development.
MVC architecture separates the application's data (model), user interface (view), and control logic (controller) into distinct components.

questions.question: What are the different types of sorting algorithms?

answers.text: Binary search, bubble sort, and selection sort.
Merge sort, quick sort, and heap sort.
Linear search, insertion sort, and bubble sort.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a primary key in a database table?

answers.text: To ensure that each record in the table is uniquely identifiable.
To allow NULL values in the table.
To enforce data types in the table.

questions.question: What is the difference between HTTP and HTTPS?

answers.text: HTTP is a secure version of HTTPS.
HTTP is a protocol used for transmitting data over the internet, while HTTPS is a secure version of HTTP that encrypts data transmitted between the client and the server.
HTTPS is a protocol used for transmitting data over the internet, while HTTP is a secure version of HTTPS.

questions.question: Explain the concept of cloud computing.

answers.text: Cloud computing is a method of storing data on physical servers.
Cloud computing is a method of accessing and managing computer resources over the internet.
Cloud computing is a method of securing data using encryption techniques.
